markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 12"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Spell-Eating Pitch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=835)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Injury" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=97" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven](/Sources.aspx?ID=49) pg. 66</row>

**Price** 325 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Two Actions" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This gummy resin contains sparkling motes of magical energy that dramatically impair your cognitive functions and dispel spells as you cast them. Spell energy manifests but then sputters out, as though drained away by the sparkling motes. While you're [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) by this poison, the DC of flat checks to avoid disruption from the stupefied condition when you Cast a Spell is 5 + twice the stupefied value, rather than 5 + the stupefied value.

 **Saving Throw** DC 31 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 5d6 poison damage and stupefied 1 (1 round); **Stage 2** 6d6 poison damage and stupefied 3 (1 round); **Stage 3** 7d6 poison damage and stupefied 4 (1 round)

**Craft Requirements** Supply one casting of 6th-level [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=78).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Spell-Eating Pitch
